intro: Rytigynia pawekiae, commonly known as the Papek's rytigynia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the family Rytigyniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. It is an evergreen shrub that thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
